sect2.title: DefaultMessageGenerator
sect2.para: The generator is able to generate a load using multiple threads for a long period of time (matter of days, weeks,...). The generator uses a thread pool of a fixed size that stores threads executing performance iterations. The thread pool uses an internal queue where tasks implementing the iterations are buffered and scheduled for execution. The size of the thread queue can be specified by the threadQueueSize property.
This approach guarantees that the maximum number of thread instances (that is equal to the value of the threadQueueSize property) exists in the memory during all the time the generator is working.
To configure the generator we need to specify a number of concurrent threads (using the threads attribute) and a duration (using the run discussed above).

The following table shows the properties of the DefaultMessageGenerator:
DefaultMessageGenerator properties
Property name Description Required Default value
senderTaskQueueSize The size of the task queue. No 1000

simplesect.title: An example of DefaultMessageGenerator configuration
simplesect.programlisting: <generator class="DefaultMessageGenerator" threads="100"> <run type="time" value="60000"/> <property name="senderTaskQueueSize" value="5000"/> </generator>
simplesect.para: In the example above a DefaultMessageGenerator is defined to run for 60 seconds using 100 concurrent threads with the sender task queue with the size of 5000. The main goal of limiting the queue of sender tasks is to limit memory usage and improve performance of PerfCake.
